Originally written in 2008 Please See This File: Where to Receive SacramentsINTRO: Our website demonstrates that a Catholic cannot attend the New Mass, of course. Our website also demonstrates the unfortunate fact that almost all of the priests who are validly ordained and celebrating a traditional Mass today (whether Roman Rite or Eastern Rite) hold heretical views.

item.title: On St. Hermenegild and Communion from heretics
item.description: Source: vaticancatholic.com St. Hermenegild was a 6th century martyr who was put to death for refusing to receive Holy Communion from his father’s Arian priest: “During Eastertime the Arian father sent to his son a bishop of his sect, offering to receive him into his favor if he would receive Holy Communion from the hands of that prelate. St. Hermenegild refused. The father, enraged, sent soldiers to put him to death.
